author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In the realm of bonds, yields stagnate,
Forthcoming rise awaits its fate,
A modest hike, a quarter's might,
Lo, the Fed's decision met with bated breath tonight.

Oil falters, losing ground,
Worries over banks' health resound,
A faltering economy, the price we pay,
As darkness overshadows wealth's display.

Oh noble nations round the door,
Resisting wars and cost, nay, no more,
Schemes to fund, their strength berate,
Taxes they refuse to elevate.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Barely Move Ahead of Anticipated 25Bp Fed Rate Rise
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields were barely changed ahead of the Fed’s rate decision—likely a 25 basis point increase—later in the day.

feedItems.title: Oil Adds to Sharp Losses on Growth Worries
feedItems.description: Oil prices edged lower in Europe as continued worries about the health of U.S. banks have revived concerns about the economy.

feedItems.title: How European Economies Are Finding New Ways to Pay for War on Their Doorstep
feedItems.description: European governments are struggling to come up with ways to pay for a new era of higher costs, but many European populations don’t want to see their already relatively high tax rates pumped up further.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of metals base and gold's fair rise,
Methinks Jerome Powell speaks wise,
To tighten grasp on fed'ral rate,
And fight the ill of sad inflate.

In Malaysia's green-stretch'd land,
The central bank doth take a stand,
Hiking rate, it doth decree,
For growth's prospects now seem free.

The dollar slumps in European tale,
As markets wait, their breaths grow pale,
Pray, will the Fed open the door?
Or pause, and let the rates restore?

feedItems.title: Base Metals Slip, Gold Rises Ahead of Fed Interest Rate Decision
feedItems.description: Base metals were slightly lower in London trade, with gold up a touch, with analysts saying Jerome Powell’s comments will be crucial as to whether he signals if the Fed will tighten further to fight inflation, despite ongoing banking sector stresses.

feedItems.title: Malaysia's Central Bank Hikes Benchmark Rate
feedItems.description: Bank Negara Malaysia raised its benchmark interest rate for the first time so far this year, saying that the economy’s growth prospects look resilient.

feedItems.title: Dollar Falls as Markets Await What Could Be Last US Rate Increase
feedItems.description: The dollar was weaker in Europe, as investors await the latest Fed decision, with the focus on whether the central bank keeps the door open to another rate increase or indicates a pause in June, RBC said.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Haleon's profit, a ship afloat at sea,
Reveals a weakened edge; its margin dips,
For in this quarter's wealth was not to be
The strength of gods, foretold by mortal lips.

In Lloyds thy tales, our mighty þaðir's fame,
Doth not escape, for profits rise and soar;
Yet customer deposits fall in shame,
Their guidance doth remain, lest they choose more.

And BNP Paribas' earnings gleam,
Exceeding expectations, wide and far;
Despite the costs, diversification's dream,
Doth make the bank a shining northern star.

feedItems.title: Haleon Key Earnings Margin Dips
feedItems.description: Haleon posted inproved pretax profit for the first quarter, but said its adjusted operating profit margin fell to 23.1%, slightly below consensus forecasts.

feedItems.title: Lloyds Backs Guidance as Profits Jump
feedItems.description: Lloyds Banking maintained its full-year outlook after it posted above-forecast profits of £2.3 billion in the first quarter, despite customer deposits falling £2.2 billion.

feedItems.title: BNP Paribas' 1Q Exceeds Expectations as Result Reflects Capital Gain
feedItems.description: RBC Capital Markets said BNP Paribas revenues exceeded consensus by 3%, overcoming cost increases which were 1.5% higher than expected, adding that the 1Q print was a good result for the bank which also benefited from its diversification.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In Stellantis' realm, fair targets do remain,
With sales ascending high, a fortune to gain,
Fourteen percent in revenue boast,
As shipments and pricing drew near utmost. 

On UniCredit's wings, outlooks do soar,
In quarters past, their earnings did floor,
By forty-four percent, their fortunes did swell,
With growth in interest, stories will tell.

Deutsche Post, in sturdy vessels are found,
Guidance unchanged, to prospects unbound,
By quarter's end, expectations surpassed,
On steadfast course, their earnings will last.

feedItems.title: Stellantis Backs Targets After Sales Rise
feedItems.description: Stellantis confirmed its full-year guidance after reporting a 14% rise in revenue in the first quarter on more shipments and higher net pricing.

feedItems.title: UniCredit Upgrades Outlook After Strong First Quarter
feedItems.description: UniCredit lifted its financial forecasts for 2023 after revenue and earnings rose above expectations in the first quarter, helped by growth of 44% in net interest income.

feedItems.title: Deutsche Post Backs Outlook After First-Quarter Beat
feedItems.description: Deutsche Post reiterated its 2023 guidance after earnings and revenue in the first quarter came in ahead of forecast.
